content.title: You can always feel product/market fit when it's happening
content.author: Marc Andreessen
content.quote_text: And you can always feel product/market fit when it’s happening. The customers are buying the product just as fast as you can make it—or usage is growing just as fast as you can add more servers. Money from customers is piling up in your company checking account. You’re hiring sales and customer support staff as fast as you can. Reporters are calling because they’ve heard about your hot new thing and they want to talk to you about it. You start getting entrepreneur of the year awards from Harvard Business School. Investment bankers are staking out your house. You could eat free for a year at Buck’s.

generation.prompt: Inspired by the feeling of: While the paragraph is literal, there's a sensation everyone has felt, that pmarca captures well.  Maybe it was winning a board game, or building a product or seeing it happen in a movie, it's not a spreadsheet it's a movement.  And he describes with clarity: "I'm not suggesting that you do ignore everything else—just that judging from what I've seen in successful startups, you can.". square composition, centered focus, 1:1 aspect ratio
